description.999: Help roofers by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment.
description.1000: Maintain highways, municipal and rural roads, airport runways, and rights-of-way. Duties include patching broken or eroded pavement and repairing guard rails, highway markers, and snow fences. May also mow or clear brush from along road, or plow snow from roadway.
description.1001: Research, analyze, record, and interpret the past as recorded in sources, such as government and institutional records, newspapers and other periodicals, photographs, interviews, films, electronic media, and unpublished manuscripts, such as personal diaries and letters.
description.1002: Teach courses in human history and historiography. Includes both teachers primarily engaged in teaching and those who do a combination of teaching and research.
description.1003: Apply knowledge of health and disease causes to evaluate new laboratory techniques and procedures to examine tissue samples. description.1004: Operate or tend hoists or winches to lift and pull loads using power-operated cable equipment.
description.1005: Repair, adjust, or install all types of electric or gas household appliances, such as refrigerators, washers, dryers, and ovens.
description.1006: Monitor the health status of an individual with disabilities or illness, and address their health-related needs, such as changing bandages, dressing wounds, or administering medication. May also help with tasks such as preparing meals, doing light housekeeping, and doing laundry depending on the patient's abilities.
description.1007: Provide inpatient care predominantly in settings such as medical wards, acute care units, intensive care units, rehabilitation centers, or emergency rooms. Manage and coordinate patient care throughout treatment.
description.1008: Welcome patrons, seat them at tables or in lounge, and help ensure quality of facilities and service.
description.1009: Accommodate hotel, motel, and resort patrons by registering and assigning rooms to guests, issuing room keys or cards, transmitting and receiving messages, keeping records of occupied rooms and guests' accounts, making and confirming reservations, and presenting statements to and collecting payments from departing guests.
description.1010: Design objects, facilities, and environments to optimize human well-being and overall system performance, applying theory, principles, and data regarding the relationship between humans and respective technology. description.1011: Compile and keep personnel records. description.1012: Plan, direct, or coordinate human resources activities and staff of an organization.
description.1013: Recruit, screen, interview, or place individuals within an organization. May perform other activities in multiple human resources areas.
description.1014: Monitor and control activities associated with hydropower generation. Monitor equipment operation and performance and make necessary adjustments to ensure optimal performance. Perform equipment maintenance and repair as necessary.
description.1015: Manage operations at hydroelectric power generation facilities. Maintain and monitor hydroelectric plant equipment for efficient and safe plant operations.
description.1016: Research the distribution, circulation, and physical properties of underground and surface waters; and study the form and intensity of precipitation and its rate of infiltration into the soil, movement through the earth, and return to the ocean and atmosphere.
description.1017: Apply principles and processes of natural ecosystems to develop models for efficient industrial systems. Use knowledge from the physical and social sciences to maximize effective use of natural resources in the production and use of goods and services. Examine societal issues and their relationship with both technical systems and the environment.
description.1018: Apply engineering theory and principles to problems of industrial layout or manufacturing production, usually under the direction of engineering staff. May perform time and motion studies on worker operations in a variety of industries for purposes such as establishing standard production rates or improving efficiency.
description.1019: Design, develop, test, and evaluate integrated systems for managing industrial production processes, including human work factors, quality control, inventory control, logistics and material flow, cost analysis, and production coordination.
description.1020: Repair, install, adjust, or maintain industrial production and processing machinery or refinery and pipeline distribution systems. May also install, dismantle, or move machinery and heavy equipment according to plans.
description.1021: Plan, direct, or coordinate the work activities and resources necessary for manufacturing products in accordance with cost, quality, and quantity specifications.
description.1022: Operate industrial trucks or tractors equipped to move materials around a warehouse, storage yard, factory, construction site, or similar location.

99: Operate tractor-trailer combinations or heavy trucks with a capacity of at least 26,001 pounds Gross Vehicle Weight (GVW).
Transport goods and materials from one location to another.
Conduct pre-trip inspections on vehicles to ensure safety and compliance with regulations.
Load cargo onto the truck in a safe and efficient manner.
Unload cargo at destination points, either manually or using equipment such as forklifts.
Maintain accurate records of driving hours, fuel consumption, and other relevant data.
Comply with all federal, state, and local regulations regarding commercial vehicle operation.
Navigate through diverse road conditions and weather scenarios to reach destinations safely.
Communicate effectively with dispatchers, managers, and other drivers regarding route changes or issues.
Perform basic maintenance tasks on vehicles such as checking oil, tire pressure, and brakes.
Report any mechanical issues or malfunctions of the vehicle to management or repair services.
Operate specialized equipment like trailers for oversized loads or hazardous materials.
Adhere to safety protocols when handling hazardous materials.
Manage fuel efficiency by optimizing routes and driving techniques.
Deal with emergencies such as accidents, breakdowns, or severe weather conditions.
Use technology such as GPS navigation systems and electronic logging devices (ELDs).
Collaborate with warehouse staff during loading and unloading processes.
Ensure cargo is properly secured to prevent shifting during transit.
Follow specific routes planned by dispatchers or use personal knowledge of efficient routes.
Conduct routine safety checks on the vehicle before and after each trip.
Interact professionally with customers when delivering goods directly to them.
Keep the truck's cab and trailer clean and organized for efficiency and inspection purposes.
Plan trips according to time-sensitive delivery schedules.
Apply knowledge of traffic laws and regulations in different states or regions.
Use defensive driving techniques to minimize risk on the road.
Monitor weather forecasts to anticipate potential delays or route changes.
Participate in training sessions to stay updated with new regulations or technologies.
Maintain a healthy lifestyle due to the physically demanding nature of the job.
Fulfill all requirements for maintaining a commercial driver's license (CDL).

675: 1. Analyzing Supply Chain Data: Evaluating logistics data to pinpoint areas for improvement in supply chain efficiency.
2. Process Optimization: Identifying bottlenecks and proposing adjustments to streamline product delivery processes.
3. Route Planning: Designing the most efficient routes for shipments to reduce costs and enhance delivery times.
4. Shipment Tracking: Monitoring the status of shipments to ensure timely arrival and resolve any issues promptly.
5. Invoicing Management: Overseeing the creation and dispatch of invoices for logistical services provided.
6. Electronic Billing Administration: Managing electronic bills and payments to facilitate smooth financial transactions.
7. Supply Chain Modeling: Creating models to simulate different supply chain scenarios and predict outcomes.
8. Cost Analysis: Conducting detailed analyses to identify areas where logistics costs can be minimized without compromising service quality.
9. Vendor Selection: Evaluating potential vendors based on their ability to meet logistical needs efficiently and cost-effectively.
10. Contract Negotiation: Negotiating contracts with suppliers and carriers to secure favorable terms and rates.
11. Compliance Monitoring: Ensuring that all logistics operations are in compliance with relevant laws, regulations, and company policies.
12. Inventory Management: Analyzing inventory levels to ensure they are aligned with demand, minimizing stockouts and overstocking.
13. Freight Audit: Conducting audits on freight bills to ensure accuracy and identify any billing errors or discrepancies.
14. Carrier Performance Evaluation: Assessing the performance of carriers based on factors like delivery time, cost, and service quality.
15. Logistics Technology Implementation: Evaluating and implementing new logistics technologies to enhance efficiency and reduce costs.
16. Data Visualization: Creating visual representations of complex logistics data to facilitate better understanding and decision-making.
17. Risk Management: Identifying potential risks in the supply chain and developing strategies to mitigate them.
18. Customer Service Improvement: Analyzing customer feedback to identify areas for improvement in logistics services.
19. Sustainability Initiatives: Developing and implementing logistics practices that reduce environmental impact.
20. Budgeting and Forecasting: Preparing budgets and forecasts for logistical operations to ensure financial planning is accurate and comprehensive.
21. Team Leadership: Leading teams of logistics professionals to achieve operational goals and objectives.
22. Training and Development: Providing training and development opportunities to enhance the skills and knowledge of logistics staff.
23. Performance Metrics Development: Creating key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the efficiency and effectiveness of logistics operations.
24. Supply Chain Resilience Planning: Developing strategies to ensure supply chain continuity in the face of disruptions or crises.
25. Reverse Logistics Management: Overseeing the process of returning products to vendors or manufacturers, ensuring it is done efficiently and cost-effectively.
26. Warehousing Optimization: Analyzing warehouse operations to identify opportunities for improving storage efficiency and reducing costs.
27. Transportation Mode Selection: Evaluating different transportation modes (road, air, sea) to select the most appropriate based on cost, speed, and reliability.
28. Customs Clearance Facilitation: Ensuring that all international shipments comply with customs regulations and are cleared efficiently.
29. Emergency Response Planning: Developing plans to respond to logistics emergencies such as natural disasters or major accidents.
30. Benchmarking: Comparing the company's logistics operations against industry best practices and competitors to identify opportunities for improvement.
31. Continuous Improvement Initiatives: Implementing a culture of continuous improvement within the logistics function, encouraging innovation and ongoing efficiency gains.
